botanical_details.genus: Agave can be perennial or monocarpic succulents, forming rosettes of usually rigid, fleshy, spiny-edged leaves, with funnel-shaped flowers in racemes or panicles often much taller than the rosettes

how_to_grow.cultivation: Under glass grow in a sharply-draining loam-based compost (JI No2) with extra perlite or sharp sand, or a proprietary cactus compost in full sunlight. Water freely during the growing season from spring to autumn but allowing the compost to dry out before watering again. Water more sparingly in winter when the plant is dormant
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed in spring at 21°C or from offsets in summer
how_to_grow.pests: scale insect and mealybugs can be a problem under glass
how_to_grow.diseases: Generally trouble free except in wet or poorly drained soil when it could be susceptible to root rot
